Record.Value: In this lesson you will learn how to fabricate new items and machines

Welcome back cadet. Today we will be using the {THING:StructureAutolathe} will turn your newly made ingots into useful items and resources. Our first task will be something simple turn on the {THING:StructureAutolathe} and print some {THING:ItemCableCoil}.
Select the {THING:ItemCableCoil} using the small arrow keys on the {THING:StructureAutolathe} or click the yellow search button to search for the {THING:ItemCableCoil} and select it.
Pick up the {THING:ItemCopperIngot} from the orange crete.
To print the {THING:ItemCableCoil} you will need to provide the {THING:StructureAutolathe} with the correct resources.
Place the {THING:ItemCopperIngot} in to the left input slot on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}
Press the big green button to start Printing, Print 4 {THING:ItemCableCoil}

Nice work cadet! The {THING:ItemCableCoil} will come in handy later on, Next, we will need to create some {THING:ItemIronSheets}. {THING:ItemIronSheets} are a key component in building most structures and machines.
Just like last time select the {THING:ItemIronSheets} from the selection menu on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Place the {THING:ItemIronIngot} in to the left input slot on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
The next component you will need is {THING:ItemPlasticSheets}, {THING:ItemPlasticSheets} are needed to complete machines.
Select the {THING:ItemPlasticSheets} from the selection menu on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Place the {THING:ItemSiliconIngot} in to the left input slot on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}
The {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} is used to create Pipes and vents among other useful items. Print a {THING:ItemKitHydraulicPipeBender} using the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Select the {THING:ItemKitHydraulicPipeBender} the selection from the {THING:StructureAutolathe} menu.
Place the {THING:ItemGoldIngot} in to the left input slot on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
We can now build the {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} use the newly made {THING:ItemKitHydraulicPipeBender} and place it in the designated location.

Using the printed components and what you have learned from the past tutorials, finish the {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} and power it up by connecting the {THING:ItemCableCoil}. Then print a {THING:ItemPassiveVent} using the {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender}.
Place the {THING:ItemIronIngot} in to the left input slot on the {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender}
